pr_title: [CALCITE-4392] The operation of checking types equal ignoring null can be more efficient

timeline.bodyText: Please factor this into a method and make the assertion messages distinguishable.
timeline.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText: Done. Thanks for the good suggestion.
replies.author: liyafan82

timeline.message: [CALCITE-4392] The operation of checking types equal ignoring null can be more efficient

timeline.bodyText: unequal  is not a valid word.
timeline.author: danny0405

replies.bodyText:
Another issue here is that both asserts have the same message, so it is hard to tell which fails.
I would suggest:
    assertThat(
        "SqlTypeUtil.equalSansNullability(typeFactory, " + type1 + ", " + type2 + "), comment: " + comment,
        SqlTypeUtil.equalSansNullability(f.typeFactory, type1, type2), is(expectedResult));
    assertThat(
        "SqlTypeUtil.equalSansNullability(" + type1 + ", " + type2 + "), comment: " + comment,
        SqlTypeUtil.equalSansNullability(type1, type2), is(expectedResult));
replies.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText: Sounds reasonable. Revised accordingly. Thank you.
replies.author: liyafan82

timeline.message: [CALCITE-4392] The operation of checking types equal ignoring null can be more efficient

timeline.bodyText: This should a parameter to compareTypesIgnoringNullability method.
timeline.author: vlsi

replies.bodyText: I guess you mean the type factory should be a parameter? Revised accordingly. Thanks.
replies.author: liyafan82

replies.bodyText: I mean different types should be a comment parameter rather than a comment
replies.author: vlsi
